For a brief moment we see a wall of flames and hear it roar.
Wall of flames. Deafening roar.
Roaring. At the cut: WHOOOOOSH! a huge low-rider motorcycle bursts through the flames, its engine roaring even louder than the fire. Its driver is a huge leather-clad hellion.
As he roars along a ribbon of desert highway.
From in front. He twirls the shotguns in either hand and reaches back to plunge them over his shoulders into their holsters.
Tracking with and also in on the Biker from behind as he roars along a strip of highway. He is reaching for the two sawed-off shotguns which are strapped crisscross across his back.
Pulling the Biker from a distance as he levels the two shotguns. The tracking camera pulls back further to reveal a running jack-rabbit keeping pace with us in the foreground.
From behind, booming down as we track. We are approaching the crest of a rise.
On a rock in the foreground, a desert lizard suns himself.
It is now morning. Ed walks back and forth, gently bouncing the baby as she walks. She is singing it a lullaby.
At the cut the rumble of the sun is snapped off by the high-
Mr. Byrum here can take your exemplars while you talk.
Sir, these men are from the FBI-
Just let your hand relax; I'll do the work.
We just need to distinguish your prints from the perpetrators', if they left any.
Sir, you might want to wash your hands at this point.
Was the child wearing anything when he was abducted?
If we're gonna put out an APB we need a description of the -
What did the pajamas-
What did the pajamas-
What did the pajamas look like?
Officer-
Would ya mind, I'm trying to set up a Command Post here!
Specifically, it is the hole in the muddy patch of earth that Gale and Evelle climbed out of. We hear only the squish - suck of many feet walking around in the mud offscreen.
After a moment, their attention returns to the hole.
His attention also returns to the matter at hand. He squints, concentrating. His bike rumbles. Gradually his face sets in a specific direction.
It is the bathroom where we earlier saw Gale and Evelle combing their hair, now empty.
An extreme close shot shows his nostrils dilating as we hear him sniff.

Hi, with Ed standing by, is just opening the door to a young couple. Glen is a short stocky blond man in his early thirties, wearing Bermuda shorts. DOT is wearing slacks, heels, and a scarf over her hair.
Where's at baby? Where's he at?
Cut it out, Glen!
Can I just sneak a peek-a-loo?
What's his name?
Whyncha call him Jason? I love Biblical names. If I had another little boy I'd name him Jason or Caleb or- Oh!
You gonna send him to Arizona State?
Well you just gotta have one! You just gotta have one this instant!
Hi, even if he don't get sick he's gotta have his dip-tet!
You started his bank accounts?
That-there's for his orthodonture and his college. You soak his thumb in iodine you might get by without the orthodonture, but it won't knock any off the college.
You gotta do that, Hi! Ed here's got her hands full with that little angel!
What would Ed and the angel do if a truck came along and splattered your brains all over the interstate? Where would you be then?
Or you got carried off by a twister?
Go find him honey!
Shit, I hope we didn't wake it!
Does the Pope wear a funny hat?
Say, that reminds me! How many Pollacks it take to screw up a lightbulb?
Nope, it takes three!
Cause they're so durn stupid!
Shit man, think about it! I guess it's what they call a Way Homer.
Cause you only get it on the Way Home.
Sure, I'd buy one.
Well maybe she can do something for me'n Dot. See there's something wrong with m'semen. Say, that reminds me! What you gonna call him?
Thought you said he was a boy.
Hear about the person of the Polish persuasion he walks into a bar holdin' a pile of shit in his hands, says "Look what I almost stepped in."
Ya damn right it's funny! Shit man, what's the matter?
And I told Dottie to lose some weight but she don't wanna listen!
Okay! That's the disease, but there is a cure.
Sure; Doctor Glen is tellin' ya you can heal thyself.
Well you just gotta broaden your mind a little bit. I mean say I asked you, what do you think about Dot?
Okay. Now it might not look like it, but lemme tell you something: She's a hellcat.
T-I-G-E-R.
Don't rush me!
Now the thing about Dot is, she thinks- and she's told me this-
I'm crappin' you negative! And I could say the same about Ed!

What'm I talkin' about?!  I'm talkin' about sex, boy! What the hell're you talkin' about?! You know, "L'amour"?! I'm talkin' me'n Dot are Swingers! As in "to Swing"! Wife-swappin'! What they call nowadays Open Marriage!
I'm talkin' about the Sex Revolution! I'm talkin' about-
Shit man!
You're crazy! I feel pity for you, man!  You-
I ain't comin' in if ya don't mind. I'll just keep my distance.
Well don't even bother. First off, you're fired - and that's official.
Well that ain't why I'm here neither. No sir. You're in a whole shitload of trouble, my friend.
Why don't you make me?! Know that little baby you got in there? Remember him? I know what his real name is!
I'll pitch my voice wherever I please! His name ain't Hi Jr.! His name ain't Ed Jr.! But it's junior an right! Yes sir, it's Nathan Jr.!
That's right! And now you're at my mercy!
You wetchaself! Mr. McDunnough wet hisseff, Daddy!
We are tracking on Hi and Glen as they walk side by side. Glen is sopping wet, wearing only swimming suit and wing-
With Hi pursuing in the background.
A hand enters to take a big carton of disposable diapers from the shelf.
A pimply-faced lad with a paper 7-Eleven cap on his head. He is looking up from a dirty magazine, reacting in horror to something approaching.
As she slams the car door shut. The siren is quite loud now.
The squad car tops a rise to bounce into view, its siren wailing.
Hi bursts out the door, still wearing the stocking. The carton of Huggies is still tucked under one arm.
Halt. It's a police warning, son. Put those groceries down and turn yourself in.
That's private property, son. Come back out to the street and reveal yourself to Officer Steensma and Officer Scott - that's me.
Legs pumping, panty hose still over his head, its unused leg streaming behind him like an aviator's scarf. The gun is tucked into his belt; the Huggies are tucked securely under his arm.
Huffing and puffing down the road with his Huggies.
Outdoors now, running, crossing the street behind the house and entering the parking lot of a supermarket on the other side.
Hi vaults a fence to land in the backyard.
On the dog, snarling and straining against the end of his chain.

The camera is shooting forward at ground level, following the Doberman as it bounds along. The Doberman is dragging his chain and spike, which stretch into the foreground, bumping and scraping along the road.
Running up a dark street. There is an oncoming pickup. Hi runs directly at it.
Son, you got a panty on your head.
Still screaming.
Ready to fire and - THUMP - he is bowled over by the arriving Doberman, still trailing chain and spike, and now accompanied by three other dogs, all braying at the top of their lungs.
Roaring up the new street, they are now directly in the path of the oncoming police car, its siren wailing, barreling straight at them.
Recovered and turned around from its near collision with the SCREAMING; Driver, the squad car is now squealing onto the street the Screamer swerved on to - resuming pursuit.
Can I stop now?
Stepped on hard. The brakes scream.
We are tracking behind Hi as he runs up to the house and crashes through the screen door.
As he runs into the house.
As a pack of dogs thunders in. The lead Doberman with chain and spike has now picked up about a dozen neighborhood dogs.

Futilely raising his gun to avoid-impact: The Huggies catch him square on the chest. The force makes him stumble one fatal step backwards - into the back aisle - where:  CRASH - He is hit broadside and bowled over by a rocketing shopping cart, propelled by an hysterically screaming SHOPPER.
Racing on down the back aisle, bellowing.

Tracking from in front. Beyond her we can see the pack of furiously barking dogs, nipping at her heels. They boil over the prostrate Officer Steensma, and this is the last we see of him in this movie.
They look up, dumbstruck and mortified, from the sofa where the have been watching TV.
We need someone handy with a scatter-
Following it, very close, we see only its rear wheel and fender and twin exhaust pipes, one on either side. Flame is boiling in each exhaust pipe as the hog roars.
From behind the Biker's head as he rides through the night. With the sharp whipcrack effect he suddenly looks left, searching. With a second whipcrack effect he suddenly looks right, still searching.
Creeping in on Nathan Jr. in the living room, asleep in his ottoman armchair, lit only by the snow from the TV set he is facing, a half-full glass of milk on the coffee table next to him.
Night sky. The motorcycle tire enters frame as the bike comes to a halt. The Biker plants a jackbooted foot in the foreground.
Roaring at the cut. Through it we can see the Biker sitting on the ground, legs stretched out in front of him, back resting against his parked motorcycle, arms folded across his chest.
It reads: "Come On In! To Unpainted Arizona."

Characters.Character: CLOSE SHOT BAR ON GLASS DOOR

Replies.Reply: Leading into the showroom. The Biker's mail-and-chained fist pushes the door open.
Behind the jackboots as they stroll through a showroom of unpainted furniture and bathroom fixtures.
Swinging as he walks, the Biker's hand produces a fresh cheroot from no apparent source-either sleight-of-hand or magic.
Similarly producing a long wooden match.
Biting down on the cigar.
Dragging the kitchen match along the unfinished wood surface of an expensive bureau, leaving an ugly black scar.
Crackling as it is lit.
Reading "Executive Offices." The mailed fist pushes it open.
From the inside of the office. The name on the pebbled glass is a backwards Nathan Arizona.
Eyes on the Biker he slams the door shut behind him, looking for some reaction.
Circling the Biker as he crosses to sit behind his desk.
No reaction. His head continues to bob and duck.
You got flies.
Nooo, I ain't a customer, I'm a manhunter. Ordinarily. Though I do hunt babies, on occasion. Hear you got one you can't put your hand to.
Wal, that's my business. I'm a tracker-
Cop won't find your boy. Cop couldn't find his own butt if it had a bell on it. Wanna find an outlaw, call an outlaw. Wanna find a Dunkin Donuts, call a cop.

Price. Fair price. And that ain't whatever you say it is; fair price is what the market'll bear. Now there are people, mind you, there are people in this land, who'll pay a lot more'n twenty grand for a healthy baby.
Give you an idea, when I was a lad I m'self fetched twenty-five thousand on the black market. And them's 1954 dollars. I'm sayin, fair price. For fifty grand I'll track him, find him-
Oh I'll get your boy regardless. Cause if you don't pay, the market will.
Amid a shower of plaster dust and lath. Hi has landed, groggily, against the toilet.
As Gale paws through the wreckage to expose the copy of Dr. Spock's Baby and Child Care. He grabs the book.
Moving down the road toward an oncoming car. As the oncoming car gets closer we can see Gale and Evelle in its front seat.
From the front bumper of an automobile. Beautiful desert stretches to the horizon. The road rushes under the camera.
A huge rumbling rippling red ball that fills the frame.
As he stands up with the piece of paper.
It is Gale's picture of the Farmers and Mechanics Bank.
across the check-out counter. Evelle has various baby purchases - the diapers, baby food, etc. - piled on the counter. The Cashier is ringing them up.
Evelle is screaming at the top of his lungs as the car rocks to a stop. He peers through the windshield, still screaming, but nothing has shot off the roof of the car.
In the foreground Nathan Jr. sits upright in his car seat, in the middle of the road that fronts the convenience store. He is placidly looking at the scenery.
In their speeding car, both staring out at the road ahead, mouths gaping, emitting ear-splitting screams.
Sitting in the front seat of their idling car, looking at the bank.
With Nathan Jr. in the foreground. Gale and Evelle's car comes to a rocking halt behind - and inches shy of - the baby.
Baking in the noonday sun.
Well which is it young fella? You want I should freeze or get down on the ground? Mean to say, iffen I freeze, I can't rightly drop. And iffen I drop, I'm a gonna be in motion. Ya see -
Yessir.

A teller is finishing stuffing the last of two burlap bags. Close on her hands, we see her putting in a cash packet that is really only a few bills and a sleeve surrounding and hiding a small plastic device.
As they top a rise coming from the other direction. We see the baby sitting in the middle of the street, and Lenny fast approaching from the background.
The extremely low wide shot, locked down to the speeding bike, shows us rushing toward the rear of Nathan Jr's car seat.
Roaring along. He hooks the car seat over his handlebars.
Shooting through where the windshield used to be, cutting in at the end of the skid as the car rocks to a halt.

Characters.Character: LOOKING DOWN AT HI AND ED

Replies.Reply: Folded over in the front seat. Below them something bounces into and around the leg well - Lenny's grenade.
As she dives for cover behind a parked car. Beyond her - KABOOM! - their car explodes and bounces, pouring black smoke.
Looking up the street to where Lenny is wheeling his bike in a U-turn. He is not finished yet.
Smoking as it skids around in the foreground, completing its turn.
Raising an arm to stab.
Drilled by Hi's bullet, drops its knife.
Quick as a flash hurling the other knife at Hi.
Swinging the chain - WHOOSH WHOOSH - at the backpedaling Hi.
Grabbing Hi by the shirtfront.
Reacting to Hi reacting. He looks down.
Trying to drop the shotguns to free his hands. In his panic his fingers tangle in the trigger guards.
Finally freeing his hands.
Blows sky-high. There is a roar as if the earth were cracking open and flame as if hell were slipping out.
As she runs toward the bank, clutching Nathan Jr. to her chest.
As she runs for the back door and pushes through it.
Just lie down on the floor, missie.
As he slaloms through the wildly scattering hayseeds.
Ed is running up the alley toward the front of the bank as Lenny enters. He roars after her.
As the bike approaches behind her.
Riderless, twisting crazily into the street where it collapses.
Lenny is rising to his feet beyond them as Hi nods encouragement to Ed.
As the chain snakes around it and rips it out of Hi's hands.
As Hi lands against it, banging his head. He sinks to the ground.
Hi's face in the foreground as he desperately seeks escape.
Lenny finally flings Hi away.
On the guns as Lenny's thumbs draw them back. He raises the guns to fire.
To the interior of the Arizona second-story nursery as the ladder comes to rest against the window frame.
Of the unpainted crib with the burned-in names: Harry, Barry, Larry, Garry, and Nathan Jr.
Nathan stands in his jammies, hair disheveled, holding a gun and squinting against the light.
A beautiful dusk landscape. We are floating in over the field, abutting the prison, that Gale and Evelle popped out of.
Craning down toward Hi.
Still floating forward but now much closer to the two walking men. We see that they are Gale and Evelle. Both are still dyed blue.
Five three-year-olds in their pajamas are opening presents around a tree as Nathan and Florence look on.

Characters.Character: FLOATING IN TOWARD A STATION WAGON

Replies.Reply: Pulled over on the state highway in the middle of the desert, a police motorcycle parked behind it. Glen is leaning out the driver's window of the car talking to the state trooper who stands facing him.
It sits on a tee in the middle of a football field.
Looking up, arms out at his sides, waiting to receive the kicked ball.
Still craning down, now very close to the sleeping Hi.
The man and woman are sitting on a sofa in the foreground with their backs to the camera. They are in the living room of Hi and Ed's trailer, which is suffused with a warm golden light.
